title: Project Planning and Requirements Gathering
description: Update the project scope, objectives, and requirements for the ThreatModelingAutomation system. This should include gathering inputs from key stakeholders (e.g., security experts, software architects, developers) to understand the current threat modeling practices, challenges, and desired features/capabilities of the automated system. Additionally, research existing threat modeling methodologies, tools, and industry best practices to inform the requirements. Consider incorporating a hybrid approach combining machine learning and human expertise for more effective and accurate threat modeling. Also, focus on providing flexible configuration options to cater to diverse threat modeling needs across different domains, while ensuring scalability and maintainability of the system. The hybrid approach should prioritize usability and efficiency, with clear user interfaces for input and output data visualization. Furthermore, document the development process, including milestones, in the RFC to provide a roadmap for the project.

title: Revised System Architecture Design for ThreatModelingAutomation
description: Provide a revised design of the overall architecture for the ThreatModelingAutomation system. The revised design should include components, data flow, integration points, and considerations for scalability, maintainability, security, and separation of concerns between frontend, backend, and database layers. Additionally, ensure proper API design for each layer to facilitate seamless communication and interactions within the system. Include a clear definition of the roles and responsibilities for each component, and outline strategies for testing, documentation, and support. Also, consider integration with existing security tools and systems where applicable.

title: Improved Threat Modeling Methodology for Automated System
description: Develop an improved and scalable methodology for automating the threat modeling process. The methodology should encompass a wide range of application architectures and technologies, capable of handling complex systems. Incorporate AI and machine learning techniques where appropriate, focusing on data collection, analysis, and threat identification methods. The methodology should also detail how the system will learn from threats over time, enhancing its predictive capabilities. Ensure that the methodology is well-documented for easy understanding by developers and other team members. Collaborate closely with the security specialist to guarantee comprehensive coverage of all necessary security aspects. To ensure scalability and adaptability, consider using a modular approach that can be easily updated as new technologies emerge. After implementation, conduct thorough testing and documentation for future reference. Finally, upon completion, provide a presentation for team members detailing the methodology, its benefits, and potential future improvements. Update this RFC to 'NEEDS_REVIEW' once the draft is complete, assign it to the project-manager for review.

title: Data Modeling and Database Design
description: Design the data models and database schemas required for storing and managing threat modeling data. The data models should support efficient querying, indexing, scalability to handle large volumes of data. Consider data normalization, integrity constraints, access control mechanisms, and optimize for performance. Align with industry best practices such as the Data Modeling Zone method or the Domain-Driven Design approach, but also consider the NoSQL database solutions like MongoDB or DynamoDB due to their flexibility, scalability, and high performance in handling semi-structured data. Also, ensure that the design is compatible with our existing tech stack and can be easily integrated with other components of the system. The design should be modular, extensible, and maintainable.

title: User Interface Design - Revised
description: Revise the user interface design for the ThreatModelingAutomation system. The updated design should include input forms for detailed system and application information, interactive visualization tools for threat modeling diagrams and data flows, comprehensive reporting features for generating threat reports, mitigation recommendations, and exportable PDF or Excel files. The design should be intuitive, user-friendly, accessible to a wide range of users with varying technical backgrounds. Additionally, consider integrating real-time threat updates, alerts, and feedback mechanisms, as well as ensuring the interface is mobile responsive and adheres to Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG). Also, add features for user authentication, authorization, and session management. Incorporate the need for integration with system architecture design and threat modeling process definition. Suggest improvements on the usability of these interconnected functionalities to ensure a seamless experience. Lastly, consider implementing dark mode and high contrast options for improved accessibility.

title: Backend Development
description: Implement the backend components of the ThreatModelingAutomation system, including threat modeling algorithms, data processing, and integration with other systems.

title: Frontend Development
description: Implement the user interface components of the ThreatModelingAutomation system, including input forms, visualization tools, and reporting features.

title: Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Develop and execute test plans for the ThreatModelingAutomation system, including unit tests, integration tests, and user acceptance testing.

title: Deployment and DevOps
description: Set up the deployment infrastructure and automate the deployment process for the ThreatModelingAutomation system.

title: Documentation and Training
description: Create user manuals, technical documentation, and training materials for the ThreatModelingAutomation system.
